text: Hey Jon, no I'm on the latest official build
I'm getting a console error and also it is not loading the v2.js file. Not sure what is going on.
Hi! Anyone having trouble with sending data with segment track method and the identify method to HubSpot? I can only make it work in testing (send data server-side)
You actually weren't ever really able to do this
There was a glitch that allowed you to do it in certain circumstances but it would break things especially when you tried to stage pages
total guess here, but is there any chance you’re testing from a blocked IP? (Settings -> Reports -> Tracking Code -> Advanced)

version `78.0.3904.97`is currently the latest(noting more for my own reference).

If you open the dev tools in chrome on a cms page experiencing this issue, do you see any console error messages?
can you DM me a link to the page you’re seeing this on

You cannot create an app on top of HubSpot’s content management system.  The apps require server-side code, which you cannot run on HubSpot.  You may want to consider hosting your app on something like Google App Engine or Amazon Web Services
It's on some html files locally so I can't unfortunatley.

Hi guys! I’m playing around with some fun code that I’m not able to incoorporate in my HubSpot pages. I’m wondering if there is any workaround to for instance have an index page that is not created in HubSpot but that still links to my HubSpot pages?
Hi all. I am trying to change our blog root URL but it will affect many of our links so wondering if anyone knows how to redirect the traffic from the old links to the new ones?
